text: NF-kappa B activity in T cells stably expressing the <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein of human T cell lymphotropic virus type I .

The effect of constitutive <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression on the interaction of NF-kappa B with its recognition sequence and on NF-kappa B - dependent gene expression was examined in T lymphoid Jurkat cell lines ( 19D and 9J ) stably transformed with a <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vector .

<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expressing T cell lines contained a constitutive level of NF-kappa B binding activity , detectable by mobility shift assay and uv cross-linking using a palindromic NF-kappa B probe homologous to the <extra_id_0> interferon beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> PRDII site .

In Jurkat and NC2.10 induction with phorbol esters resulted in the appearance of new DNA binding proteins of 85 , 75 , and 54 kDa , whereas in <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expressing cells the 85-kDa protein and a 92-kDa DNA binding protein were constitutively induced .

Expression of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in 19D and 9J resulted in transcription of the endogenous NF-kappa B - dependent <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene and increased basal level expression of transfected NF-kappa B - regulated promoters .

text: Nonetheless transcription of both the endogenous and the transfected gene was inducible by PMA treatment .

<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in Jurkat T cells may alter the stoichiometry of NF-kappa B DNA binding proteins and thus change the expression of NF-kappa B - regulated promoters .
